intro: Epidendrum sangayense, commonly known as the Sangay Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It is a terrestrial orchid characterized by its erect, branching stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, yellow, and green, typically arranged in racemes. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
